title: "What topics are covered in the philosophical journal: 104 TAURULUS and the nature of reality, metaphysics and magic?"
first_phrase: In the last part of this text, we explore different topics related to magic, esotericism, and metaphysics. We start by discussing the experiences of Taurulus, followed by EA's explanation of the metaphysical reality. Throughout the text, we cover various subjects, including Narayana Swami Aiyar's work on the transformation of man and metal and Rud's first ascent. We also delve into the role of magic in Hindu speculation and the symbolism of the year in different traditions. This portion concludes with LEO's essay on "The Feathered Serpent" and the relationship between metapsychics and magical phenomena.

last_phrase: In conclusion, this text covers a wide range of topics related to spirituality, mysticism, and esotericism. It provides insights into the human and cosmic rhythms, the limits of initiation, the transformation of man and metals, symbolism of the year, the magic of victory, and the origins of species. It also delves into various aspects of magic, sacrifice, and the role of mysticism in Christianity and Hinduism. The text also touches upon metapsychic phenomena and explores the awakening of the self. Overall, it serves as a valuable resource for those seeking deeper understanding and practical knowledge of these subjects.
